intro: Erigeron capusii, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually white to pale blue, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Erigeron capusii is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to support local pollinators.
